intro: Psychotria rhodothamna, commonly known as the red-veined psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with deep red veins. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
